values:
I will be unavailable for the next week, two at the most.

Don't any of you get into too much trouble.

To <lj user="awordfortruth">, <lj user="beneathwings">, <lj user="hacchan">, <lj user="mybluetomorrow">, and <lj user="sungvespers">.

May this year and every year hereafter be joyous and wonderful.

Tonight, I was pleasantly surprised.  I received a message, one I never thought to expect.  But Fate has always had her own plans, plans that I could not ever even begin to fathom for a forever of an eternity.

The memories make me smile.  It's been a long time since I've truly done that.

Several months ago, I was told -- no, promised -- that I would not be abandoned. I was promised that my other half was found and that he would be going nowhere. He would be here should I so need him, just as I would be for him. It was a lie. There are no words to describe how I feel right now. None. At. All. Neither do I have an avatar to express this. There is just... nothing.
As my Dear daughter has seen fit to be kind, I have decided that a change is in order. Please, tell me what you think, hm?

I have indirectly received something I didn't expect.

Thank you.
Even in seemingly harsh cruelty, there is inexorable beauty and unalterable renewal.

It would seem that another assistant has joined the ranks.  Welcome.

I'm contemplating whether I should design a uniform for such an auspicious position.
I hope that you have a wonderful birthday.
It would appear that it is official now. Does this mean that there will be a parade in my honor?
"Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden where the flowers are dead." - Oscar Wilde I couldn't agree more.

Mmm, I ad a nce tme with Niicha tonght.  Too bad Acchan wa tkin a nap.

Acchan, yu shuld call me whn yu wake up na.

No matter where I am today, I never forget how you affected it, how you brought happiness into my life for the time that I've known you.  Today, I'll be visiting you and after stop by your parents' home to say hello.  I haven't seen them in a long time...

Happy birthday, Shinwa.
